intro: Matelea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, and it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Matelea microphylla is often found in desert or semi-desert environments, showcasing its adaptation to arid conditions.
